claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A two-column page: left column shows the table of contents for the document (sections like Introduction, Methods, Recommendations for the Use of Influenza Vaccines, etc.); right column shows a section titled “CDC Adoption of ACIP Recommendations for MMWR Recommendations and Reports, MMWR Policy Notes, and Immunization Schedules” with descriptive text about ACIP and CDC publication process, followed by a footer listing CDC staff, MMWR editorial and production staff, and editorial board. The image does not support the claim because it contains only a table of contents, CDC publication process text, and staff listings with no information on vaccine production, mutations, or effectiveness; it does not support the claim.
